workflow.name: Generate multi-channel release notes from ClickUp tasks with GPT-4o, Notion & Slack
workflow.description:
This workflow converts raw ClickUp task updates‚Äîreceived directly through a webhook‚Äîinto fully automated release documentation. It validates incoming payloads, fetches and cleans task details, enriches them with AI-generated metadata, produces structured release notes using GPT-4o, publishes them to Notion, notifies stakeholders on Slack, emails a formatted summary, and logs the release into Google Sheets.
The system handles malformed events gracefully by logging invalid payloads and continues only when a valid task_id is present. It extracts structured fields (title, description, links, priority, assignee), then augments them with AI-driven classifications such as risk level, change type, module, and impact score. GPT-4o generates polished release notes following a strict template. Finally, the workflow distributes the release across multiple channels while maintaining an auditable, centralized history.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

üü¢ Webhook ‚Äî Receive ClickUp Task Update
 Captures incoming events from ClickUp via POST and forwards the raw body for parsing.

üßπ Code in JavaScript ‚Äî Extract task_id
 Parses the raw webhook body and safely extracts task_id.
 Invalid JSON ‚Üí forwarded to error logging.

üîç Validate Incoming ClickUp Task Event
 Checks if task_id exists.
 Valid ‚Üí continue workflow
 Invalid ‚Üí log error to Google Sheets

üìÑ Fetch Full Task Details from ClickUp
 Retrieves full task metadata: title, description, status, priority, links, assignee details, and due date.

üß© Extract Clean Task Fields from ClickUp Data
 Normalizes and structures the task fields into a clean, usable JSON object.

üß† Provide GPT-4o Model for Metadata Extraction
 Loads the language model for metadata generation.

üîç Generate Release Metadata via AI
 AI generates structured metadata including:
 ‚Ä¢ risk_level
 ‚Ä¢ change_type
 ‚Ä¢ module
 ‚Ä¢ impact_score
 ‚Ä¢ requires_testing

üßπ Parse AI Metadata JSON Output
 Parses stringified JSON from the AI node into valid structured JSON.
 Malformed metadata ‚Üí returned as an error object.

üîÄ Merge Task Details with Metadata
 Combines clean task fields with AI-generated metadata into a complete release-ready object.

üß† Provide GPT-4o Model for Release Notes
 Supplies the language model needed to generate formal release notes.

‚úçÔ∏è Generate Structured Release Notes via AI
 Produces uniform release notes containing:
 ‚Ä¢ Summary
 ‚Ä¢ Improvements & Features
 ‚Ä¢ Bug Fixes
 ‚Ä¢ Impact Analysis
 ‚Ä¢ Known Issues

üìù Extract Release Notes Title & Final Output
 Extracts title from markdown and prepares final content for publishing.

üìò Create Release Notes Page in Notion
 Saves the release notes as a new page in the Notion Release Notes database.

üí¨ Post Release Announcement to Slack
 Sends formatted release notes + Notion link to the specified Slack user/channel.

üìß Send Release Summary Email
 Sends a structured HTML email with the release summary, full notes, and Notion link.

üìä Append Release Log Entry to Google Sheet
 Writes a complete release log entry including:
 ‚Ä¢ task ID
 ‚Ä¢ title
 ‚Ä¢ priority
 ‚Ä¢ module
 ‚Ä¢ risk level
 ‚Ä¢ Notion URL
 ‚Ä¢ Slack message URL
 ‚Ä¢ release date

üõë Log Invalid ClickUp Events to Google Sheet
 Stores any invalid or incomplete webhook payload for debugging and auditing.

## üß© Prerequisites
 ‚Ä¢ ClickUp API token
 ‚Ä¢ Public webhook endpoint in n8n
 ‚Ä¢ Azure OpenAI GPT-4o credentials
 ‚Ä¢ Notion API integration
 ‚Ä¢ Slack API token
 ‚Ä¢ Google Sheets OAuth
 ‚Ä¢ Gmail OAuth

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úî Converts ClickUp updates directly into finished release documentation
 ‚úî AI-powered metadata ensures consistent classification
 ‚úî Instant multi-channel dissemination: Slack + Email + Notion
 ‚úî Automatic logging for audit, QA, and release governance
 ‚úî Eliminates manual writing, formatting, and cross-platform updates

## üë• Perfect For
-  Product teams running constant sprints
-  Engineering teams needing reliable release documentation
-  Teams using ClickUp as their primary task manager
-  Organizations with multi-channel release communication needs

options.systemMessage:
=You are a professional release notes writer for a product team.
Your job is to turn raw task data into clear, structured, non-marketing release notes.

Rules:
- Always follow the given section headings and order.
- Keep language simple and easy to skim.
- Prefer bullet points over long paragraphs.
- Do NOT write an FAQ. Only write release notes in the requested format.

nodes.name: Extract Release Notes Title & Final Output
Create Release Notes Page in Notion
Append Release Log Entry to Google Sheet

value.Title: ={{ $('Extract Clean Task Fields from ClickUp Data').first().json.title }}
value.Module: ={{ $('Combine Task Info + Metadata into Final Payload').item.json.module }}
value.Priority: ={{ $('Extract Clean Task Fields from ClickUp Data').first().json.priority }}
value.Risk Level: ={{ $('Combine Task Info + Metadata into Final Payload').item.json.risk_level }}

parameters.message:
=

üöÄ New Release Published

Feature: {{ $('Extract Release Notes Title & Final Output').item.json.title }}

Summary:

{{ $('Extract Release Notes Title & Final Output').item.json.release_notes.split("\n\n")[1] }}

Full Release Notes:

{{ $('Extract Release Notes Title & Final Output').item.json.release_notes }}

Notion Page: Click here to view

Released On: {{ new Date().toISOString().split("T")[0] }}
parameters.subject: =New Release Published ‚Äì {{ $('Extract Release Notes Title & Final Output').item.json.title }}

nodes.name: Provide GPT-4o Model for Metadata Extraction

parameters.text:
=Analyze the task details below and extract structured metadata useful for release management.

Task Data:
{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}

Return ONLY a valid JSON object with the following fields:

{
  "risk_level": "low | medium | high",
  "change_type": "feature | fix | enhancement | refactor",
  "module": "backend | frontend | ui | automation | analytics | other",
  "impact_score": 1-10,
  "requires_testing": true or false
}

Rules:
- Be accurate and concise.
- Infer values from description, priority, and status.
- If uncertain, make the best logical guess.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a senior engineering analyst. 
Your job is to classify changes based on risk, complexity, and module.
Always return clean JSON. No explanations.

nodes.name: Combine Task Info + Metadata into Final Payload

parameters.content:
## üöÄ Generate Release Notes Using ClickUp + GPT-4o + Notion + Slack
This workflow transforms raw ClickUp task updates into complete release documentation.
It validates incoming events, fetches task details, extracts clean metadata, generates
professional release notes using GPT-4o, creates a Notion page, posts announcements
to Slack, sends formatted release emails, and logs everything into Google Sheets.

The system ensures:
‚Ä¢ Clean task extraction (title, assignee, priority, description, links)  
‚Ä¢ AI-generated release notes with structured sections  
‚Ä¢ AI metadata classification (risk level, module, impact, change type)  
‚Ä¢ Centralized Notion documentation creation  
‚Ä¢ Automated Slack announcements for the team  
‚Ä¢ Email notifications for leads/managers  
‚Ä¢ Error handling + invalid event logging  

This replaces hours of manual writing and communication with a consistent, 
high-quality automated release workflow.

## üìù ClickUp Event Intake & Validation
Captures incoming task update events and validates them before processing.

‚Ä¢ Webhook  
  Receives raw ClickUp event payload via POST.

‚Ä¢ Code in JavaScript  
  Parses the raw body and extracts `task_id` safely.

‚Ä¢ Validate Incoming ClickUp Task Event  
  Ensures `task_id` exists before moving forward.

‚Ä¢ Log Invalid ClickUp Events to Google Sheet  
  Records malformed or incomplete events for debugging and audit tracking.

## üîç Task Data Extraction & Metadata Enrichment
Fetches full task information and enhances it with AI-generated metadata.

‚Ä¢ Fetch Full Task Details from ClickUp  
  Retrieves detailed task data (status, description, custom fields, assignee).

‚Ä¢ Extract Clean Task Fields from ClickUp Data  
  Normalizes task values (title, assignee email, priority, link, URL).

‚Ä¢ Generate Release Metadata via AI  
  GPT-4o infers risk_level, module, change_type, impact_score, testing needs.

‚Ä¢ Parse AI Metadata JSON Output  
  Converts AI output (stringified JSON) into usable structured JSON.

## üß© Merge Task Details with Metadata
Combines clean task fields with AI-generated metadata into one payload.

‚Ä¢ Merge Task Details with Metadata  
  Joins task information and metadata into a single combined dataset.

‚Ä¢ Combine Task Info + Metadata into Final Payload  
  Produces the finalized release-ready object used in downstream automation.

## ‚úçÔ∏è AI-Generated Structured Release Notes
Creates high-quality release notes using GPT-4o with strict formatting rules.

‚Ä¢ Provide GPT-4o Model for Release Notes Generation  
  Supplies AI engine to the release-notes agent.

‚Ä¢ Generate Structured Release Notes via AI  
  Builds release notes with sections: Summary, Improvements, Bug Fixes, Impact, Known Issues.

‚Ä¢ Extract Release Notes Title & Final Output  
  Extracts title + prepares clean release notes for Notion, Slack, and Email.

## üì£ Automated Release Communication & Documentation
Creates documents, notifies teams, and logs release details.

‚Ä¢ Create Release Notes Page in Notion  
  Stores full release notes in the Release Notes database.

‚Ä¢ Post Release Announcement to Slack  
  Sends formatted release summary to the selected Slack user/channel.

‚Ä¢ Send Release Summary Email  
  Sends a beautifully formatted HTML release summary to email recipients.

‚Ä¢ Append Release Log Entry to Google Sheet  
  Logs task ID, priority, module, risk level, Notion URL, Slack message URL, and release date.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
